{{also|termin|termín}} ==German== {{wikipedia|lang=de}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|da|la|terminus||boundary, limit, end}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/tɛʁˈmiːn/}} * {{audio|de|De-Termin.ogg}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-Termin.ogg}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Termines|gen2=Termins|Termine}} # [[date]] # [[deadline]] {{gloss|date on or before which something must be completed}} # [[delivery]] date {{gloss|day on which something is scheduled to arrive at the delivery address}} # [[appointment]], [[engagement]] {{gloss|pre-arranged meeting between people}} # {{lb|de|sports}} [[fixture]] {{gloss|scheduled match}} # {{lb|de|law}} [[hearing]] {{gloss|legal procedure done before a judge, without a jury}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-m|(e)s|e}} ====Hyponyms==== * {{l|de|Arzttermin}} * {{l|de|Prüfungstermin}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Arzttermin}} * {{l|de|Prüfungstermin}} * {{l|de|Termineinlage}} * {{l|de|Termingeld}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
